014package org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer;
015
016import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
017import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
018import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
019import java.lang.annotation.Target;
020
021import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.internal.BindBeanListFactory;
022
023/**
024 * Binds each property for each value in the annotated {@link Iterable} or array/varargs argument,
025 * and defines a named attribute as a comma-separated list of each bound parameter name.
026 *
027 * Used to create query similar to:
028 * select * from things where (id, name) in ((1,'abc'),(2,'def'),(3,'ghi'))
029 *
030 * <pre>
031 * &#64;SqlQuery("select * from things where (id, name) in (&lt;keys&gt;)")
032 * List&lt;Thing&gt; getThings(@BindBeanList(value = "keys", propertyNames = {"id", "name"}) ThingKey... thingKeys)
033 * </pre>
034 * <p>
035 * Throws IllegalArgumentException if the argument is not an array or Iterable.
036 */
037@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
038@Target({ElementType.PARAMETER})
039@SqlStatementCustomizingAnnotation(BindBeanListFactory.class)
040public @interface BindBeanList {
041    /**
042     * The attribute name to define. If omitted, the name of the annotated parameter is used. It is an error to omit
043     * the name when there is no parameter naming information in your class files.
044     *
045     * @return the attribute name.
046     */
047    String value() default "";
048
049    /**
050     * The list of properties to invoke on each element in the argument
051     *
052     * @return the property names
053     */
054    String[] propertyNames();
055}
